resources.string: Aagama 2k18
Generating the fun..
Loading the energy..
All Set to Go..!
Departments
Left for the exciting event to begin

To be abreast of recent developments and to provide a common platform to the budding technocrats from all over the country, to have knowledge shared and to explore new horizons in the concerned Engineering, Pharmaceutical and Management streams, Anurag Group of institutions is going to conduct Aagama 2K18 on 16th and 17th March, 2018. In the present scenario, professional education like engineering is demanding overall development from the students. A student is expected to acquire thorough technical knowledge along with other supportive skills. With this back drop, technical papers are invited from all the corners of the country. All the papers will be peer reviewed. There are many events like Tech Quiz, Paper presentation, Project presentation, Robotics, Circruitrix, Inversion and many more.

Description:
Here one can present his or her knowledge on various technical topics from the field of computer science linked to various fields.

Rules:
1) Team of maximum 2 members is allowed.
2) Cash prize for the winner is Rs.2000/-.

Circuit will be shown on a paper for a particular amount of time. The participant should remember all the values of the components present in the given circuit. Then, a circuit with no values will be given and the participant should write down all the correct values as shown in the previous circuit. Participant writing maximum correct values in minimum time will be rewarded.

1) Maximum of 2 members are allowed in a team.

Description:
An event wherein participants will be quizzed on topics from the engineering world and more! The quiz involves pictures, words, descriptions and choosing correct options all revolving around technology. The difficulty increases with each level and it is the survival of the SMARTEST!

Rules:
1) The individual participants will register and each phase will contain 6 participants.
2) Each level will have 15 questions with words, pictures etc and participant with LEAST points will be eliminated. There will be 5 levels and every successive level gets difficult.
3) The final round will be a one on one rapid fire round and the participant with maximum points wins.
4) On day 2, the winners from day one will participate in the grand finale and we will have new phases too.

Coordinators:
1) VV. Santhosh Kumar(7893076104)

Registration fee:
50/-

Description:
“Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence”. These best phrases by Vince Lombardi has lighten up our minds! It’s all about how you put your topic or present your topic infront of the audience. They see the way you present your topic, the way you put your point, your presentation style, your language and how promptly and effectively you answer their questions. Come up with innovative ideas!

Structure of the event:
1) Select a thesis and create suitable Abstract.
2) Submission of Abstract (in a IEEE formatted word document) for not more than 300 words before review date and mail to aagama.mech2k18@gmail.com (MS word 2010 is recommended).
3) Selected participants should submit a soft copy of the paper with Abstract in IEEE format to aagama.mech2k18@gmail.com.
4) Winner is decided by a selected delegate invited from respective head of department.

Rules:
1) Maximum of two authors.
2) Presentation should be a maximum of 7 to 10 minutes.
3) Based on the peering review of the abstract , few papers will be selected for presenting the paper.
4) The oral presentation should be in the form of Microsoft Power Point slides to the maximum of 8 to 10 slides.
5) The presentation is strictly confined to only technical topics.
LAST DAY FOR THE SUBMISSION OF ABSTRACT:MARCH 12TH,2018
No . of days of event : 2
Faculty coordinator:
P.Saritha(9949672656)

The main aim of this event is to provide students with some general advice on how to produce informative and architectural models. The important thing is to start with a clear purpose to your architectural model and then work out on what sort of model will be best to achieve your goal.

Rules:

2) Two participant for team.
3) Minimum of two levels.
4) Charges applied.

Description:
It's time to awaken the mechanical engineer inside you. Here is a platform to showcase your technical as well as management skills. This event is to test your teamwork reflexes, technical knowledge and awareness.
This event consists of 3 rounds-
1) Unitech
 2) Tom and Hurry
 3) Fast and Curious
Structure:
Round 1- Unitech:
Each team will be provided with a box which contains tokens with alphabet or letter or number on it. Any parameter or quantity is announced for which the team has to guess the unit.
Round 2- Tom and Hurry:
One of the team members will be given a card which has a mechanical component's name or word which he has to enact and other person has to guess the word within the time limit and arrange the letters of the word.
Round 3- Fast and Curious:
A person is blindfolded and given shuffled letters. He/she has to arrange it as the second person directs to form a mechanical term.

Rules:
1) A team shall consist of 2 members.
2) The participants shall not be allowed to use mobiles and other electronic devices.
3) Audience shall not give any hints or clues to the competitors.
4) Any kind of indiscipline activity the team will be disqualified.

Coordinators:
Byreddy. Viveknath Reddy(9542227924)

Registration fee:
50/-

Description:
Code Maze is an event which has two levels. The first level consists of a puzzle. When the puzzle is solved, output will be present. Next level is to write the code based on the output. The code is to be written directly in the editor. When the code is compiled, the given output must be displayed. The output must be same and accurate. There is a time limit for the event. Both the levels must be completed within 3 minutes. The outputs will be easy and can be written in basic C-language. The top 2 teams will be awarded with prizes. Event includes fun in solving the puzzle and knowledge in coding.

Rules:
1) Each team consists of 2 participants.
2) The time limit is 3 minutes.
3) Both the levels must be completed within the given time-limit.
4) The outputs must match(from the puzzle and the editor).

Coordinators:
1) Lalitha(8008033754)
2) Pooja(7702250959).

Registration fee:
50/-

Description:
This competition is designed for students to display skills in processor assembly with great precision and speed. All the components must be replaced back on the CPU and to the right positions. Participants will identify the different processor components and arrange them to a working CPU. Follow instructions to put together a Processor parts using the right components and tools.

Rules:
1) Only one participant.
2) Participants will have to assemble the CPU from the available components.
3) Breaking of components strictly prohibited.

Registration fee:

Description:
Send the abstract to aagama2k18pharmacy@cvsr.ac.in with the subject of format of ‘Abstract – your id.no – your name’. The topic is about Pharmacy.

Rules:
The following things are considered:
1. Scientific Content(50%):
(1)Introduction and background with pertinent literature cited.
(2)Objectives clearly stated and concise.
(3)Materials and methods (study design) clear.
(4)Results and discussion clear, concise and accurate.
(5)Significance of results to field of study.
2. Presentation(50%):
(1)Organization.
(2)Logical orders, minimum redundancy.
(3)Smooth transitions between presentation slides.
3. Slides:
(1)Legible with large fonts, color contrast, no conflicting backgrounds.
(2)Text with no grammatical errors; not excessively wordy.
Delivery:
(1)Clear and audible speech.
(2)Eye contact with audience.
(3)Effective use of figures and/or tables.
(4)Effective use of time.

Coordinators:
1) J. Hema(9959245954)

Registration fee:
50/-

Description:
1)A team should contain a maximum of 2 members. Submit an abstract with not more than 200 words, on or before 12:00PM 15th March, 2018)
2) Topic-Pharmacy.
3) Send the abstract to aagama2k18pharmacy@cvsr.ac.in with the subject of format -‘Abstract –your id. no – your name’.
4) Please include your complete details (i.e. name, email id) in the abstract.
5) The size of the poster should be of 1*1.
6) The font size should be large enough, so that it can be readable from 1 meter distance.
7) The font style should be Times New Roman or Calibri.
8) The posters received after 12)00pm, 17TH March, will not be considered in the competition.
9) The aspects considered in the competition are: Technical content of presenter, Presentation skills, Poster format and appearance.
10) Topics are: Pharmaceutics, Pharmacology, Pharmaceutical analysis, Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Pharmacognosy, Regulatory affairs, Hospital Pharmcy,Industrial Pharmacy.

Coordinators:
1) Manisha(8121815435)
2) Sowmya(7032289377) 

Registration fee:
50/-

Description:
 It is a quiz based on Pharmacy subject.

Rules:
1) Each team will comprise of 3 candidates.
2) The quiz will have 1 Elimination round and 3 final rounds.
3) 4 teams will be selected for final round.
4) The last date of receiving the registration fee is 15th March 2018
5) Elimination : This will consist of 15 objective questions which have to be solved in 5 minutes. 4 highest scoring teams will compete in the finals.
6) The last 3 rounds will be played among 4 teams.
7) Finals: Consists of 3 rounds.
(1)First round: General questions and Visual Round.
(2)Second round: Buzzer Round.
(3)Third round: Rapid Fire Round.

Description:

The participant whose selfie gets maximum number of likes will be the winner of contest.

2) The selfie may be single, couple or group.
3) The fake liker apps or websites are not allowed. If used, they will be disqualified.

Description:
Pulling the rope.

Rules:
1) No inappropriate language will be tolerated.
2) Please wear proper athletic shoes - NO CLEATS!
3) Gloves may be worn.
4) Players may only pull for one team.
5) A single team may consist of minimum 5 players.
6) No wrapping the rope around any body part during pull.
7) First team to pull mid-rope marker 6ft. beyond midline is the winner.
8) Direction of pull will be decided by a coin toss.
9) Starting cues : “Take the strain” (teams pick up rope, prepare)

Description:
This is a quiz on films.

Rules:
1) Each team will comprise of 3 candidates.
2) The quiz will have 1 Elimination round and 3 final rounds.
3) 4 teams will be selected for final round.
4) The last date of receiving the registration fee is 15TH March 2018 with a Demand Draft of Rs.300/- (group of three students)
5) Elimination : This will consist of 15 objective questions which have to be solved in 5 minutes. 4 highest scoring teams will compete in the finals.
6) The last 3 rounds will be played among 4 teams.
7) Finals : Consists of 3 rounds
8) First round: General questions and Visual Round
9) Second round: Buzzer Round
10) Third round: Rapid Fire Round

Description:

Description: Treasure hunt

Rules:
1) The Treasure Hunt consists of number of clues, each one leading to one or more treasures. 
2) At each treasure location, except as noted in rule #3, there are four slips of paper –one of each team's color. Find your team's colored treasure and turn it in at your team's headquarters. Then turn in the treasure at Treasure Hunt headquarters and tell which clue led you to that treasure. If you correctly match treasure and clue, your team will be awarded the points for that clue. Each team is allowed only three guesses at which clue a given treasure matches; after the third incorrect guess, the treasure is discarded. All treasures have been marked for identification, but these markings are generally insignificant to teams. The treasures with significant markings, such as those for clue #30, will always be identified in the clues.
3) The points awarded for clue #50 are not necessarily dependent on the handing in of colored pieces of paper. Treasures associated with clue #30 are marked with letters to be exchanged for the correspondingly-lettered word clues for the double crostic. 

Coordinators:
1) Swathi(9573440184)
2) Akshay(7032302532)
